and how this card is terrible
kiku is typing their term paper on this card

A lot of people have already made this point, but it really does bear repeating. Crystal Ray only provides frontloaded damage, and it just doesn't match up well at all with guardians other options for that. When I'm taking common attacks (strike+ type cards like twin strike, dagger throw, ball lightning, flying sleeves) at the beginning of the run, I'm doing it in order to end fights faster and thus take less damage in early hallway and elite fights. They need to be very efficient, and they need to be good at their job RIGHT NOW. Gremlin nob (and sentries/lagavulin to a lesser extent) is coming up quickly, and you need to be able to deal enough damage to kill it before it attacks you on turn 4, and ideally before the attack on turn 3 if you can manage it. It's cute that crystal ray can get better at dealing damage later, but you need it to perform well immediately, and 14 damage for 2 energy is just abysmal compared to roll attack, strike for strike, incinerate, reroute, really just about every other option you have. Even worse, all it does is damage, there is no utility whatsoever to the card, so it can't help support your synergies in other ways, and it's inefficient at the only thing it does. By the time it would be acceptable (20 damage for 2 energy, requiring 4 socketed gems), you shouldn't need to be adding any more front loaded damage to your deck anyways. It's also worth noting that this only counts socketed gems, so you need to have found gems, cards with sockets, reach a campfire, and potentially socket in a suboptimal way before reaping any benefits from crystal ray. Even worse, unsocketed gems are quite poor cards to have into all 3 elite fights in act 1 (air against lagavulin and tri-sentries, not efficient damage against nob). In theory, you can run this with snecko eye or necronomicon and it would be reasonable. The upgrade is fine at +4.

I really think this card needs to completely redesigned, as it just has no home whatsoever right now. It's an early game pure damage card that's awful in the early game and outshone by every other option available.
it never really occurred to me that you are literally spending 20-30 minutes on every one of those essays
until I saw you typing in chat, and then saw you still typing in chat 20 minutes later

Anyways, here's a wacky idea for making this not suck as much: Make it a poor man's gem cannon. Same stats as now, but it exhausts any un-socketed gems and counts all gems towards its damage. That way it has a use in act 1--not for dealing damage, but for cleaning up your deck and thus lowering the risk from taking a lot of gems.
Guardian has some of the best attacks in the downfall mod. This is not one of them

Even in the ideal deck for this. Gem cannon as your scaling and a snecko eye to reduce crystal rays cost. This card is still only barely passable even when you can make it do 35+ damage. This is because if you have that many gems already; you just want to draw gem cannon ASAP since it will win the fight for you when its played.
you would think a common attack that supports the almighty gem cannon would be strong. But crystal rays numbers are just so bad that even that good concept doesent work out for it.
